assessment_template_create_payload.title: Compliance Readiness Assessment
assessment_template_create_payload.description: This comprehensive 28-point assessment evaluates organizational readiness for cybersecurity compliance across seven critical domains including organizational foundation, security policies, technical controls, risk management, data protection, business continuity, and vendor management to ensure regulatory compliance and security maturity.

categories.title: Organizational Foundation
categories.description: Evaluates the fundamental organizational structure, industry context, and leadership commitment necessary for establishing effective cybersecurity compliance programs.

questions.title: Industry-specific cybersecurity requirements understanding
questions.description: Assesses the organization's awareness of industry-specific cybersecurity standards and regulatory requirements applicable to their business operations.
questions.remediation_tips: Conduct industry standards mapping, engage compliance consultants, and implement sector-specific frameworks like HIPAA for healthcare or PCI DSS for payment processing.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate knowledge of applicable industry standards such as HIPAA, PCI DSS, CMMC, SOX, or sector-specific regulations.

criteria.description: No awareness of industry-specific requirements or significant gaps in compliance understanding
Basic awareness of industry requirements but incomplete understanding or inconsistent application
Comprehensive understanding of industry requirements with established compliance framework
Limited industry-specific requirements or compliance managed at corporate level

questions.title: Business criticality and service classification
questions.description: Evaluates how the organization classifies the criticality of its services and the corresponding cybersecurity maturity requirements.
questions.remediation_tips: Conduct business impact analysis, classify services by criticality, and align cybersecurity controls to service classification levels.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess service criticality classification and alignment of security controls to business impact levels.

criteria.description: No service criticality classification; uniform security approach regardless of business impact
Basic service classification but inconsistent security control alignment
Comprehensive service criticality framework with risk-based security control implementation
Service classification not relevant due to uniform business operations

questions.title: Sensitive data handling and classification
questions.description: Assesses the organization's approach to identifying, classifying, and protecting sensitive data types including PII, PHI, and financial information.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement data classification policy, conduct data inventory, and establish handling procedures based on sensitivity levels.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate data classification schemes, handling procedures, and protection measures for sensitive information.

criteria.description: No data classification system; unclear handling of sensitive data types
Basic data classification but inconsistent handling procedures or protection measures
Comprehensive data classification with appropriate handling and protection procedures
Minimal sensitive data processing or handled entirely by external providers

questions.title: Cybersecurity leadership and governance structure
questions.description: Evaluates the presence and effectiveness of cybersecurity leadership roles such as CISO or equivalent security management structure.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish dedicated security leadership role, define governance structure, or engage vCISO services for strategic security guidance.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess security leadership presence, authority level, and governance structure effectiveness.

criteria.description: No dedicated security leadership; ad-hoc security management approach
Basic security leadership but limited authority or part-time security focus
Dedicated security leadership with appropriate authority and governance structure
Security leadership provided by parent organization or external vCISO service

categories.title: Security Policies and Procedures
categories.description: Assesses the development, implementation, and maintenance of cybersecurity policies, procedures, and security awareness programs.

questions.title: Cybersecurity policy framework completeness
questions.description: Evaluates the comprehensiveness and currency of documented cybersecurity policies and procedures covering all essential security domains.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop comprehensive policy framework covering access control, incident response, asset management, and other critical security domains with regular review cycles.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess policy coverage, documentation quality, approval processes, and maintenance schedules.

criteria.description: No formal cybersecurity policies or severely outdated documentation
Basic policies exist but gaps in coverage or inconsistent maintenance
Comprehensive policy framework with regular reviews and stakeholder approval
Policies managed at corporate level or organization size doesn't require formal framework

questions.title: Security awareness training program effectiveness
questions.description: Assesses the implementation and effectiveness of security awareness training programs for employees and contractors.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy security awareness platform, conduct regular training sessions, implement phishing simulations, and track training effectiveness metrics.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate training frequency, content quality, participation rates, and effectiveness measurement.

criteria.description: No formal security awareness training program or very low participation
Basic training program but inconsistent delivery or limited effectiveness tracking
Comprehensive training program with regular delivery, simulations, and effectiveness metrics
Training handled entirely by external provider or minimal workforce

categories.title: Technical Security Controls
categories.description: Evaluates the implementation and effectiveness of technical cybersecurity controls including asset management, endpoint protection, network security, and vulnerability management.

questions.title: Asset inventory and management system
questions.description: Assesses the organization's ability to maintain accurate inventory and lifecycle management of all IT assets including hardware, software, and virtual assets.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement automated asset discovery tools, deploy RMM solutions, establish asset lifecycle management processes, and maintain accurate CMDB.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate asset discovery methods, inventory accuracy, lifecycle tracking, and management tool deployment.

criteria.description: No systematic asset inventory; significant gaps in asset visibility and tracking
Basic asset inventory but manual processes or incomplete coverage
Comprehensive automated asset management with lifecycle tracking and regular audits
Asset management handled entirely by external MSP or minimal IT infrastructure

questions.title: Secure asset disposal procedures
questions.description: Evaluates the organization's processes for securely disposing of IT assets and ensuring complete data destruction.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish asset disposal policy, implement secure data wiping procedures, use certified disposal services, and maintain disposal documentation.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess disposal procedures, data destruction methods, vendor certification, and documentation practices.

criteria.description: No formal disposal procedures; risk of data exposure through improper asset disposal
Basic disposal procedures but inconsistent application or inadequate data destruction
Comprehensive secure disposal procedures with certified destruction and proper documentation
Asset disposal handled by external provider or minimal asset turnover

questions.title: Configuration management and baseline enforcement
questions.description: Assesses the organization's ability to maintain secure configurations and enforce baseline security settings across all devices and systems.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy RMM tools for configuration management, establish security baselines, implement automated configuration enforcement, and maintain change control processes.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate configuration baseline establishment, enforcement mechanisms, change control, and compliance monitoring.

criteria.description: No standardized configurations; devices deployed with default or inconsistent security settings
Basic configuration standards but inconsistent enforcement or limited automation
Comprehensive configuration management with automated enforcement and change control
Configuration management handled entirely by external MSP

questions.title: Endpoint protection solution deployment
questions.description: Evaluates the implementation and effectiveness of endpoint protection solutions across all organizational devices.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy enterprise endpoint protection platform, configure advanced threat detection, implement EDR capabilities, and establish monitoring procedures.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess endpoint protection coverage, advanced threat detection capabilities, response features, and monitoring effectiveness.

criteria.description: No endpoint protection or basic antivirus only; significant gaps in endpoint security
Basic endpoint protection but lacks advanced features or incomplete coverage
Comprehensive endpoint protection with advanced threat detection and response capabilities
Endpoint protection entirely managed by external MSP

questions.title: Network security and segmentation
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of network security controls including monitoring, logging, and network segmentation strategies.
questions.remediation_tips: Create network diagrams, implement network monitoring, deploy IDS/IPS systems, establish network segmentation, and enable comprehensive logging.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate network security architecture, monitoring capabilities, segmentation implementation, and security control effectiveness.

criteria.description: Minimal network security controls; flat network architecture with limited monitoring
Basic network security but limited segmentation or monitoring capabilities
Comprehensive network security with proper segmentation, monitoring, and threat detection
Network security entirely managed by external provider or minimal network infrastructure

questions.title: Firewall implementation and rule management
questions.description: Evaluates the deployment and management of firewall solutions including rule configuration, monitoring, and maintenance.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy enterprise firewall solution, implement deny-by-default rules, establish regular rule reviews, and enable comprehensive logging and monitoring.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess firewall deployment, rule configuration quality, monitoring capabilities, and maintenance procedures.

criteria.description: No firewall or basic consumer-grade protection; inadequate network perimeter security
Basic firewall deployment but suboptimal rule configuration or limited monitoring
Enterprise firewall with well-configured rules, monitoring, and regular maintenance
Firewall management handled entirely by external provider

questions.title: VPN solution for remote access security
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of VPN solutions to secure remote worker access to organizational resources.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy enterprise VPN solution, implement strong authentication, configure encryption protocols, and establish remote access monitoring.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate VPN deployment, authentication methods, encryption strength, and remote access security controls.

criteria.description: No VPN or insecure remote access methods; significant risk from remote worker connections
Basic VPN deployment but weak authentication or limited security features
Comprehensive VPN solution with strong authentication, encryption, and monitoring
No remote workers or VPN managed entirely by external provider

categories.title: Risk and Vulnerability Management
categories.description: Evaluates the organization's approach to identifying, assessing, and managing cybersecurity risks and vulnerabilities including risk assessments, vulnerability scanning, and patch management.

questions.title: Periodic cybersecurity risk assessment program
questions.description: Assesses the organization's implementation of regular cybersecurity risk assessments and risk management processes.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish risk assessment policy, conduct regular risk assessments, implement risk treatment plans, and maintain risk register with regular updates.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate risk assessment frequency, methodology, documentation quality, and risk treatment effectiveness.

criteria.description: No formal risk assessment process; ad-hoc approach to risk management
Basic risk assessments but infrequent or limited scope and follow-up
Regular comprehensive risk assessments with documented treatment plans and monitoring
Risk assessments conducted at corporate level or by external provider

questions.title: Continuous vulnerability scanning and management
questions.description: Evaluates the implementation of continuous vulnerability scanning and systematic vulnerability management processes.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy automated vulnerability scanning tools, establish scanning schedules, implement vulnerability classification and prioritization, and track remediation progress.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess vulnerability scanning coverage, frequency, prioritization methods, and remediation tracking.

criteria.description: No vulnerability scanning program; unknown security posture and exposure
Basic vulnerability scanning but irregular frequency or poor remediation tracking
Comprehensive continuous vulnerability scanning with prioritization and remediation tracking
Vulnerability management entirely handled by external MSP

questions.title: Patch management procedures and automation
questions.description: Assesses the organization's systematic approach to identifying, testing, and deploying security patches across all systems.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish patch management policy, deploy automated patch management tools, implement testing procedures, and maintain patch deployment schedules.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate patch identification processes, testing procedures, deployment automation, and compliance tracking.

criteria.description: No systematic patch management; systems vulnerable due to missing security updates
Basic patch management but inconsistent deployment or limited automation
Comprehensive automated patch management with testing and compliance tracking
Patch management entirely handled by external MSP

categories.title: Data Protection and Access Control
categories.description: Evaluates data protection measures including email security, access control, authentication, encryption, data loss prevention, and secure data disposition.

questions.title: Email security and anti-phishing protection
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of email security solutions to prevent malicious email threats and data loss through email channels.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy comprehensive email security platform, implement anti-phishing protection, configure DLP for email, and establish email encryption capabilities.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate email security platform capabilities, threat detection effectiveness, DLP implementation, and encryption usage.

criteria.description: Basic email protection only; significant exposure to email-borne threats and data loss
Moderate email security but gaps in advanced threat protection or DLP capabilities
Comprehensive email security with advanced threat protection, DLP, and encryption
Email security entirely managed by email provider or external service

questions.title: Centralized account and access management
questions.description: Evaluates the implementation of centralized identity and access management systems for consistent access control across the organization.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy centralized identity management system, implement role-based access control, establish access provisioning and deprovisioning procedures, and enable comprehensive access logging.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess centralization level, access control granularity, provisioning processes, and access monitoring capabilities.

criteria.description: Decentralized access management; inconsistent access controls and poor visibility
Partially centralized access management but gaps in coverage or automation
Fully centralized access management with RBAC, automated provisioning, and comprehensive logging
Access management handled by cloud providers or minimal access control requirements

questions.title: Strong password policy and multi-factor authentication
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of robust password policies and multi-factor authentication across organizational systems.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish comprehensive password policy, deploy password management solution, implement MFA for all users, and enforce strong authentication for privileged accounts.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate password policy strength, MFA deployment coverage, password manager usage, and authentication enforcement.

criteria.description: Weak password policies; no MFA implementation; significant authentication vulnerabilities
Basic password policies and limited MFA deployment
Strong password policies with comprehensive MFA deployment and password management
Authentication entirely managed by cloud providers or SSO solutions

questions.title: Centralized logging and security monitoring
questions.description: Evaluates the implementation of centralized logging and real-time security monitoring capabilities across all systems.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy SIEM solution, configure comprehensive log collection, establish monitoring rules and alerting, and implement automated incident detection.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess logging coverage, centralization level, monitoring capabilities, and incident detection effectiveness.

criteria.description: Minimal logging; no centralized monitoring; poor security visibility
Basic logging and monitoring but limited coverage or alerting capabilities
Comprehensive centralized logging with real-time monitoring and automated alerting
Logging and monitoring entirely handled by external SOC or MSP

questions.title: Data encryption implementation
questions.description: Assesses the deployment of encryption technologies to protect data at rest, in transit, and during processing.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement encryption policy, deploy encryption for data at rest and in transit, enable device encryption, and establish key management procedures.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate encryption coverage, implementation quality, key management practices, and compliance with encryption standards.

criteria.description: Minimal encryption deployment; significant data exposure risk
Basic encryption but gaps in coverage or weak key management
Comprehensive encryption deployment with proper key management and standards compliance
Encryption handled by cloud providers or minimal sensitive data processing

questions.title: Data disposition and secure deletion procedures
questions.description: Evaluates the organization's processes for securely disposing of data and ensuring complete data destruction when no longer needed.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish data disposition policy, implement secure data wiping tools, define retention schedules, and maintain destruction documentation.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess disposition procedures, secure deletion methods, retention compliance, and documentation practices.

criteria.description: No formal data disposition procedures; risk of data exposure through improper deletion
Basic disposition procedures but inconsistent application or inadequate secure deletion
Comprehensive data disposition procedures with secure deletion and proper documentation
Data disposition handled by external providers or minimal data retention requirements

questions.title: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) measures
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of Data Loss Prevention technologies and procedures to prevent unauthorized data disclosure and leakage.
questions.remediation_tips: Deploy DLP solution, configure data classification and detection rules, implement monitoring across endpoints and networks, and establish incident response for DLP events.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate DLP solution deployment, rule configuration, monitoring coverage, and incident response integration.

criteria.description: No DLP implementation; significant risk of data leakage and unauthorized disclosure
Basic DLP deployment but limited coverage or rule configuration
Comprehensive DLP implementation with advanced detection and incident response integration
DLP handled by cloud providers or minimal sensitive data processing

categories.title: Business Continuity and Incident Response
categories.description: Evaluates the organization's preparedness for business continuity, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity incident response including backup procedures and recovery capabilities.

questions.title: Backup and recovery procedures
questions.description: Assesses the implementation of comprehensive backup and data recovery procedures to ensure business continuity and data protection.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish backup policy with RTO/RPO objectives, deploy automated backup solutions, implement 3-2-1 backup strategy, and conduct regular recovery testing.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate backup coverage, automation level, testing frequency, and recovery capability validation.

criteria.description: Inadequate backup procedures; significant risk of data loss or extended recovery times
Basic backup procedures but gaps in coverage, automation, or testing
Comprehensive backup strategy with automated procedures, offsite storage, and regular testing
Backup and recovery entirely handled by cloud providers or external services

questions.title: Business continuity planning and procedures
questions.description: Evaluates the organization's business continuity planning capabilities and preparedness for operational disruptions.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop comprehensive BCP documentation, conduct business impact analysis, establish recovery procedures, and perform regular continuity testing.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess BCP documentation completeness, testing frequency, stakeholder training, and plan maintenance.

criteria.description: No formal business continuity planning; significant operational risk during disruptions
Basic continuity planning but limited testing or incomplete coverage
Comprehensive business continuity plan with regular testing and stakeholder training
Business continuity managed at corporate level or minimal operational complexity

questions.title: Disaster recovery and failover capabilities
questions.description: Assesses the organization's technical disaster recovery capabilities and ability to failover critical systems during emergencies.
questions.remediation_tips: Implement disaster recovery plan, establish alternative processing sites, configure automated failover mechanisms, and conduct DR testing exercises.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate DR plan completeness, failover automation, testing procedures, and recovery time objectives.

criteria.description: No disaster recovery capabilities; extended downtime risk during major incidents
Basic DR planning but limited automation or testing
Comprehensive disaster recovery with automated failover and regular testing
Disaster recovery handled by cloud providers or external services

questions.title: Incident response and recovery playbook
questions.description: Evaluates the organization's cybersecurity incident response capabilities including documented procedures and response team readiness.
questions.remediation_tips: Develop incident response plan, establish response team roles, create incident playbooks, and conduct tabletop exercises for incident response testing.
questions.scoring_instructions: Assess incident response plan quality, team preparedness, playbook completeness, and exercise frequency.

criteria.description: No formal incident response plan; reactive approach to security incidents
Basic incident response plan but limited testing or unclear procedures
Comprehensive incident response program with tested procedures and trained team
Incident response entirely handled by external SOC or MSP

categories.title: Vendor Risk Management
categories.description: Evaluates the organization's approach to managing cybersecurity risks from third-party vendors, suppliers, and business partners.

questions.title: Vendor risk assessment and management program
questions.description: Assesses the organization's systematic approach to evaluating and managing cybersecurity risks from third-party vendors and service providers.
questions.remediation_tips: Establish vendor risk management policy, implement vendor assessment procedures, maintain vendor inventory, and conduct regular risk reviews.
questions.scoring_instructions: Evaluate vendor assessment processes, risk classification methods, ongoing monitoring, and contract security requirements.

criteria.description: No vendor risk management program; significant third-party security exposure
Basic vendor assessments but inconsistent application or limited ongoing monitoring
Comprehensive vendor risk management with regular assessments and contract requirements
Minimal third-party relationships or vendor risk managed at corporate level
